name: Paneer Pulao
history: Paneer Pulao is a delightful variation of the traditional Indian pulao, incorporating paneer (Indian cottage cheese) as the main ingredient. It's a popular choice in vegetarian Indian cuisine, known for its rich and satisfying taste.
description: Paneer Pulao is a flavorful rice dish made with basmati rice, paneer cubes, and a mix of aromatic spices. It's a simple yet delicious meal, often served with raita or a curry, and is popular for its combination of soft paneer and fragrant rice.

instructions.title: Prepare Rice
instructions.description: Wash and soak basmati rice for 30 minutes. Cook until it's 80% done. Drain and set aside.

instructions.title: SautÃ© Paneer and Spices
instructions.description: In a frying pan, heat oil. Add cumin seeds, bay leaf, cinnamon, cardamom, cloves, and sautÃ©. Add onions and green chilies, cook until onions are golden. Add ginger-garlic paste, turmeric powder, green peas, and paneer cubes. SautÃ© for a few minutes.

instructions.title: Combine Rice with Paneer Mixture
instructions.description: Add the cooked rice to the paneer mixture. Sprinkle garam masala and salt. Gently mix everything together.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Garnish with chopped coriander leaves. Serve the Paneer Pulao hot with raita or a curry of your choice.

tips: Fry paneer cubes to a light golden color for added texture.
Ensure the rice grains are fluffy and separate to avoid a mushy pulao.
variations: Add cashew nuts or raisins for a sweet and nutty flavor.
Experiment with different vegetables like carrots or bell peppers.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat in a microwave or on a stove until hot.
presentationTips: Serve in a decorative serving dish, garnished with fried onions or nuts.
Pair with a side of cucumber raita or a simple salad for a complete meal.
